title: Amazon and Visa reach fee-payment agreement
text:
An Amazon representative did not immediately respond to a request for comment.

Late last year. Amazon AMZNannounced it would no longer accept Visa V credit-cards issued in the U.K. starting in 2022 due to the “high cost of payments,” though Visa argued that its fees were competitive.

Amazon will also reportedly stop charging Visa users extra fees in Singapore and Australia.

Some analysts at the time said the move was possibly a negotiating tactic by Amazon, and could even push some consumers toward Mastercard MA or American Express AXPAXP.
